messages.subject: Jin-Roh:The Wolf Brigade + Stray Dog Screencaps
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.streamload.com/secretarytocapt3 folder JinRoh:the Wolf Brigade and Stray Dog Kerberos Panzer Cops password makoto note: the screencaps for Stray
messages.messageBody:
http://www.streamload.com/secretarytocapt3
folder "JinRoh:the Wolf Brigade and Stray Dog Kerberos Panzer Cops"
password "makoto"

note: the screencaps for Stray Dog Kerberos Panzer Cops are all
bitmaps because my art program kept crashing, the screencaps for
Jin-Roh are jpegs with some commentary here and there :P

In terms of chronological sequence Mamoru Oshii made
1 RED SPECTACLES (live-action)

2 Jigoku no banken: kerubersu (live-action)
Stray Dog: Kerberos Panzer Cops (2003) (USA) (DVD title)
Stray Dogs (1991) (Japan: English title) (informal title)
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0228457/

3 Jin-Rô (anime feature) (title has multiple spellings Jin-roh)
Jin Roh: The Wolf Brigade (2001) (USA)
Kerberos Panzer Cops (1998)
Wolf Brigade, The
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0193253/

*all 3 are connected [but] Jin-Roh (the anime) stands alone well, the
first 2 are not for general audiences not because of the content but
just overall weirdness ^_^...but all these seem to be brilliant
synthesis of Shinsengumi lore
